body_html:
So it seems that your python2 has tensorflow 1.3.0 installed. That hints to a problem with pip.

A likely reason is that when you do pip install tensorflow==1.8, the pip is actually pip3.

You can therefore try:
pip2 show tensorflow tensorflow-gpu tf-nightly tensorflow-hub
pip3 show tensorflow tensorflow-gpu tf-nightly tensorflow-hub

If indeed your pip is actually pip3 (you can check also with which pip), you'll have to call pip2 install tensorflow==1.8 tensorflow_hub==0.1.0.

A likely reason is that when you do pip install tensorflow==1.8, the pip is actually pip3.
You can therefore try:

pip3 show tensorflow tensorflow-gpu tf-nightly tensorflow-hub
If indeed your pip is actually pip3 (you can check also with which pip), you'll have to call pip2 install tensorflow==1.8 tensorflow_hub==0.1.0.
body:
So it seems that your python2 has tensorflow 1.3.0 installed. That hints to a problem with pip.

A likely reason is that when you do `pip install tensorflow==1.8`, the `pip` is actually `pip3`.

You can therefore try:
`pip2 show tensorflow tensorflow-gpu tf-nightly tensorflow-hub`
`pip3 show tensorflow tensorflow-gpu tf-nightly tensorflow-hub`

If indeed your `pip` is actually `pip3` (you can check also with `which pip`), you'll have to call `pip2 install tensorflow==1.8 tensorflow_hub==0.1.0`.
